item.title: Alicia add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Pam Brown
item.description: "Cats can work out mathematically the exact place to sit that will cause most inconvenience." -- Pam Brown

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "And how do you know that you're mad? "To begin with," said the Cat, "a dog's not mad. You grant that?" I suppose so, said Alice. "Well then," the Cat went on, "you see a dog growls when it's angry, and wags it's tail when it's pleased. Now I growl when I'm pleased, and wag my tail when I'm angry. Therefore I'm mad." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Alicia add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Never laugh at live dragons." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Lloyd Alexander
item.description: "Fantasy is hardly an escape from reality. It's a way of understanding it." -- Lloyd Alexander

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Amy Tan
item.description: "We dream to give ourselves hope. To stop dreaming - well, thatâ€™s like saying you can never change your fate." -- Amy Tan

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Edward Albee
item.description: "What I mean by an educated taste is someone who has the same tastes that I have." -- Edward Albee

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Robert J. Sawyer
item.description: "Learning to ignore things is one of the great paths to inner peace." -- Robert J. Sawyer

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Alicia add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "Writing is a socially acceptable form of schizophrenia." -- E.L. Doctorow

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Glen Cook
item.description: "Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day." -- Glen Cook
